titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Kings County chapter of the New York State Society of Professional Engineers publications ARC.146
titlestmt.author: Weatherly Stephan
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was priginally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

did.unittitle: Kings County chapter of the New York State Society of Professional Engineers publications

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: New York State Society of Professional Engineers. Kings County Chapter

did.abstract: The Kings County chapter of the New York State Society of Professional Engineers publications includes chapter bulletins from 1940-1966. The bulletins include reports from chapter committees, meeting minutes, brief articles relevant to area engineers, and abstracts of lectures delivered at chapter meetings. Publications also list members of the executive board, committee members, and new members to the chapter.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition for the collection are unknown. The Robert Moses pamphlet was the gift of Jill W. Sanders in 2023 and the other publications may have come from the same source.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The New York State Society of Professional Engineers was the founding state society of the National Society of Professional Engineers. The Bronx County chapter, New York State's first chapter, was founded in 1926, followed by the Kings County chapter in 1928. The Society's mission was to provide engineers with professional development and economic opportunities. The Kings County chapter held regular monthly meetings at the Brooklyn Engineers' Club, located on Remsen Street in Brooklyn Heights. During the time period covered in this collection, membership grew steadily, from 1600 members in 1949 to 2200 members in the late 1950s.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Kings County chapter of the New York State Society of Professional Engineers publications, ARC.146, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level. This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2025.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Kings County chapter of the New York State Society of Professional Engineers publications consists of copies of the chapter's bulletin from 1940-1966, during which time it went by three titles: The Engineer's Bulletin, The Kings County Professional Engineers' Bulletin, and Kings County Professional Engineer. Publications include reports from chapter committees, meeting minutes, brief articles relevant to area engineers, and abstracts of lectures delivered at chapter meetings. Publications also list members of the executive board, committee members, and new members to the chapter. The collection also includes one booklet of remarks made by Robert Moses upon his receiving an award from the chapter for construction of the Verrazzano-Narrows bridge, May 8, 1965.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
